Class MyLocationsInterface

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • MyLocationsInterface
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants

    public class MyLocationsInterface
extends javax.swing.JFrame
    This class displays the Graphical User Interface for the page "My Locations".
    Author:
    Marc Stahl
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • MyLocationsInterface

        public MyLocationsInterface(java.lang.String[] h,
                    java.lang.String[] c,
                    int num)
        Initialize the array of cities, and an integer variable to track the number of cities.
        Parameters:
        h - List of locations in HTML format.
        c - List of locations with city and country code separated by a comma.
        num - The number of locations that start in the location list.

    • Method Detail

      • initUI

        public void initUI()
        In this method, all of the Swing components are created and displayed.
        Throws:
        org.json.JSONException - This exception is thrown if the JSONObject retrieved from Open Weather Map does not follow the proper JSON format.

      • addToGUICityList

        public void addToGUICityList(int cityListPos)
        This method receives as input the index of a city. Then, this method makes a toggle button, and a remove button corresponding to that city. Both buttons are then added to their respective linked lists, added to 'jpanelInsideSP' to be displayed on screen, and are each given an action listener.
        Parameters:
        cityListPos - The index of the city.

      • isInCityList

        public boolean isInCityList(java.lang.String check)
        Determines if a city is already in the locations list. Note that this method is set up only to receive the city name in HTML format.
        Parameters:
        check - The city to be searched for in the locations list.
        Returns:
        True if the city is in the list, false otherwise.

      • posInCityList

        public int posInCityList(java.lang.String check)
        Determines if a city is already in the locations list. Note that this method is set up only to receive the city name in Comma format.
        Parameters:
        check - The city to be searched for in the locations list.
        Returns:
        The index if the city is in the list, -1 otherwise.

      • removeFromCityList

        public void removeFromCityList(int indexToBeRemoved)
        Removes a city from the locations list. Note that this method only removes the city from the internal list, and not from the locations list displayed on screen. That is done in the action listener for the remove button.
        Parameters:
        indexToBeRemoved - City to be removed from the list.

      • tabShortMouseClicked

        private void tabShortMouseClicked(java.awt.event.MouseEvent evt)
